# Dispersión de datos

Estos datos muestran la importancia de graficar los datos para entender lo que estamos analizando. Todos los gráficos son datos con la misma media y la misma varianza y la misma cantidad de datos.

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(datasauRus)
library(ggplot2)
```

```{r}
dsd <- datasaurus_dozen
dsd$dataset <- factor(dsd$dataset)
str(dsd)
summary(dsd)
dsd
```


```{r}
resumen <- dsd %>% 
  group_by(dataset) %>% 
  reframe(n = n(), mediaX = mean(x), medianaX = median(x), sdX = sd(x), mediaY = mean(y), medianaY = median(y), sdY = sd(x))
resumen
```

```{r fig.height=8, fig.width=8}
#ggplot(dsd, aes(x = x, y = y)) + 
ggplot(dsd, aes(y = y)) + 
  geom_boxplot() +
  stat_boxplot(geom = "errorbar",
               width = 0.25) +
#  geom_jitter(width = 0.1) +
  xlab("Muestra") + ylab("Largos (cm)") +
  ylim(0,100) + 
  facet_wrap(~dataset)
```


```{r fig.height=15, fig.width=9}
ggplot(dsd,
       aes(x=x, y=y, colour=dataset)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.5) +
  theme_minimal() + # theme_minimal() theme_grey() theme_bw() theme_linedraw() theme_light() theme_dark() theme_minimal() theme_classic() theme_void()
  theme(legend.position = "none") +
  facet_wrap(~dataset, ncol=3) + 
  theme(aspect.ratio = 1)
```

## Pipes y capas (layers) de ggplot2
```{r fig.height=8, fig.width=8}
dsd %>% 
  group_by(dataset)  %>% 
    ggplot() + 
    aes(x = x, y = y, colour=dataset) +
    geom_boxplot() +
    stat_boxplot(geom = "errorbar", width = 0.25) +
    geom_point(alpha = 0.3) +
    theme_minimal() + 
    theme(legend.position = "none") +
    xlab("Muestra") + ylab("Largos (cm)") +
    ylim(0,100) + 
    theme(aspect.ratio = 1) + 
    facet_wrap(~dataset)
```
